I completely relate and Iâ€™m about oh 10-15 years ahead of you in terms of that journey.  I just went thru the densest fog from Oct/Nov. until Motherâ€™s Day when it lifted, not magically but through the efforts and things Iâ€™ve learned in those 10 years of experience Iâ€™ve got on you.  

Iâ€™d probably still be in that fog, one of the worst Iâ€™ve had in over a decade, if I didnâ€™t actively work to get out of it.  Some of that â€œactiveâ€ work is learning how to let go and not do/think anything.  

You are already so far along because youâ€™ve self identified a ton of stuff and you are naturally slowing down to go one step at a time ... I still have to remind myself one step at a time very actively.  

First congratulate yourself for being able to articulate all you have in this post!  Show your wife this post and tell her youâ€™re doing well and you will keep fighting everyday!

Here is where to start thatâ€™s helped me and itâ€™s on YouTube so itâ€™s free:
[Zaroj MH daily morning mix](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL46Svm1QFC_xduJ1hIAIcFNdVNto8HTNq) 

If you donâ€™t get into that playlist let me know and Iâ€™ll send you the individual links there are only 9)
Iâ€™ll leave you with this ... I have never, personally, â€œlikedâ€ Steve Jobs or Steve Harvey: 
But I have the utmost respect for both men based on the stories of vulnerability they have presented for us in the videos!  

Make your own playlist after youâ€™re ready too ... everyoneâ€™s afraid man.  True strength is being able to stand strong in the face of that fear and manage it!   But look at you, only one therapist visit and you are already automatically self correcting thatâ€™s freaking  massive!!!!!

Everyone has fear ... move past that, itâ€™s your task not his ... clearly he is fine, and he will be for a moment (I struggled thru that for 2 years), but donâ€™t tarry 

Ex: we spoke the other day and she slipped in â€œoh right Iâ€™m 5 years older than youâ€ and I corrected her ... she is 5 years 11 mos and 348 days older than me so almost 6 years.  She said something akin to â€œI thought it didnâ€™t matter to you.â€

It still doesnâ€™t!   Iâ€™ve known the exact age gap for the entire time.  I also remembered her birthday, Pearl Jam and Eddie Vetter are her thing from the 90s (real original lol) ... I still know when she is troubled by life and try to aid as a friend!

Heâ€™s fine.  You need to work through this.  Everyone is scared lol.  I was scared I was too young for her ... Ultimately I just didnâ€™t care because it was her ... not anything that â€œmakes up â€˜herâ€™â€ ... that I loved. Best of luck.  Itâ€™s your task ... so donâ€™t let anyone else tell you what to 
do. you know how you feel and itâ€™s OK no matter what that is!

Edit:   I said the wrong thing more than a few times.  It took two years of going thru it before I agreed to the last time she said ... â€œmaybe the age is too much...â€.  I donâ€™t agree to this day, but I agreed with her that time because I couldnâ€™t keep going through it ... itâ€™s her task.

42M. You need to work through this quickly.  I was in the exact same situation just 40 and 46.  We were from the same generation.  I mean I have a brother a year older than her ... itâ€™s not an issue at all.  It became an issue because she just couldnâ€™t let it go...

The most important thing for me sometimes is to repeat â€œok, not alone.â€  Nothing beyond that during struggles ... nothing else matters at that moment just breathe and focus.  

The most helpful to me has been a varied approach: YouTube for motivational videos and spiritual videos, books and of course support from my doctor.  Itâ€™s not easy but you can do it.  

On Monday, the fog of my mind lifted and this week has been a new beginning again.  But I now have to work to build myself back up.
You can.  But you arenâ€™t required to.

42M Pretty accurate comments below.  Feel honest to me based on my 1 year experience.  My top 3 were Tinder, Bumble, and CMB - I was having really good initial luck on Hinge, and liked the platform, but that was December and Iâ€™d burned out with my efforts by then.

CMB was doing well for me but the 3 meets that progressed to dates were with women in different places from me.  I looked at it like they were a year or a few ahead of me in being ready to move on to the next stage of life.  

Iâ€™m back to some self improvement and introspection etc.

First on Bumble, seemed to hit it off and I was too comfortable communicating then she got scarred off.  2nd match on Tinder and I tried the different approach, less sentences in my texts. Lol.  But it fizzled out on both parts.  3rd match on Tinder again. I was upfront about prior 2 matches and she freaked out and unmatched.  4th match on Hinge she noticed quicker and unmatched.  She liked my profile for the 5th time this week, 3rd time on Tinder, and I havenâ€™t decided if I match again just because I think this may be the closest I get an OLD relationship ğŸ¤·ğŸ½â€â™‚ï¸. 42M - great question!  Iâ€™d like to find a partner in my age range to really click even on a generational level.  Iâ€™ve tried here are some observations of mine that are reflected in my adaptation to OLD:
40s women tend to really know what they want and arenâ€™t prepared to waste a second if there is a hint that my interests might vary
40s women are very savvy thus if you slip up just once in communication because of a bad day or whatever itâ€™s â€œstrike 1â€ 
40s divorcÃ©es with kids arenâ€™t about to have me tell them what to do in this day and age, but I need to figure out how to do that with chivalry and old fashioned confidence while being the pursuer
40s women have too fond a memory of Mr Big from SiTC and any other Hollywood character thatâ€™s not the most realistic.  
40s divorcÃ©es empty nesters arenâ€™t about to wait a moment longer because my youngest is only in 8th grade. 

To be clear these are my observations only

Itâ€™s a tall order.  Itâ€™s worth it and Iâ€™m going to keep at it but it takes work.  

Sometimes I will change my age range to take a break ... Iâ€™ve definitely found my bottom limit - 30 though I use 29 to catch the OLD age errors (Iâ€™m not 50 but canâ€™t change).  I keep hoping that maybe Iâ€™ll match with a women in the +\- 5 years range but dip down into the 30s range itâ€™s a different set of expectations and filters to account for ...

Yes. My specific twist to it is: I see all my contacts and I donâ€™t want to bother them with my trouble or cause them any inconveniences.  I am very empathic so I â€œfeelâ€ (jump to conclusions) about them judging me or avoiding me etc... it starts a self fulfilling cycle that is really hard to break.  

Another farcical saying â€œthe only thing to fear is fear itself.â€   If they only knew how scary fear really can be.  

Youâ€™re not alone.  Itâ€™s taken me a long time (20 years) to be able to recognize, rationalize and communicate that.

I was doing really well (ups and downs) for about 1.5 year and situational circumstances have caused me issues again.  So Iâ€™m struggling and Iâ€™m back to a support of people who donâ€™t know exactly the demons I deal with but they can relate.  Youâ€™re not alone and the darkness is not so dark when youâ€™re not alone.

Focus on how much room for improvement your mind has.  Focus on how strong you are to have struggled, survived and are now aware enough to make that realization on your own ... which means you are ready to come up with a resolution plan too!   

One step at a time ... yesterday I had an episode where I was up early and on top of my game, really aggressive but couldnâ€™t focus or concentrate on one task then the ride came to an end at 4pm and I crashed for 3 hours woke up anxious and depressed to the max.   This morning I woke up and thanked myself for being able recognize it at 7:30 last night (30 minute struggle) and take the 3 hours to resolve the situation.    Today was an â€œoffâ€ day but nothing like it used to be.   

Looks how far youâ€™ve come already!

I went on dates with the other 3 matches (first come first served and all) it was expensive, intense and exhausting.  After which I had to take a break.
